page.title: 08Scotton/Northorpe:Farming-2
page.content: (2) Crops and Livestock Arable farming predominates, the main crops being barley, wheat, rye, sugar beet, grass, oil seed rape, peas and potatoes (a number of women find casual employment helping with the potato harvest). Some years ago many farmers kept livestock - sheep, pigs and cattle, but increased costs of foodstuff and of labour have made it uneconomic for all but a few. Now there are only two Scotton farmers with livestock - sheep: at lambing time a favourite walk for children and adults alike is to see the lambs in the fields down Kirton Road. At Northorpe Robert Dickinson keeps the prizewinning Northorpe Herd of South Devon Cattle. The Dickinsons have a collection of rare breeds of farm animals and their living "museum" is visited by many school parties.
